fu.util

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • fu.util.Matrix

  • public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
    Matrix computations and solve lineare equations (also overdetermined). The matrixes are defined as double[][], whereas the first index defines the row, the second the column (i.e. the [0] is the array of the first row). The constants vector is defined as double[]. To solve, e.g. 
     x*1+y*2=100
 x*5-y*10=30
    The corresponding code is: 
        double[][] mat=new double[][]{
      {1.0,   2.0 },
      {5.0, -10.0 }
    };
    double[] constants=new double[] {
      100.0,
      30.0
    };
    double[] res=solveLinearEquation(mat,constants);
    After this, res[0]=x, res[1]=y. The core methods (invert, gaussian) were found at http://www.sanfoundry.com/java-program-solve-linear-equation/
    Author:
    Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@th-nuernberg.de)

        b - constant vector b
        Returns:

      • solveOverdeterminedLinearEquation

        public static double[] solveOverdeterminedLinearEquation(double[][] a,
                                                         double[] b)
        "Solve" an overdetermined linear equation ax=b for matrix a (m>n) and constants b. Note that the result is not acutally the solution as usually overdetermined equations do not have any. Instead, the return is the vector that minimizes the square errors. It bases on the approach to solve ATAx=ATb.
        Parameters:
        a - matrix a
        b - constant vector b
        Returns:
        variables x
